Title: Amoana (Orchidaceae, Laeliinae) a new genus from Mexico
Keywords:
Amoana, Encyclia, Epidendrum kienastii, Mexico, Oaxaca,
Orchidaceae
Abstract:
Encyclia is regarded as a monophyletic genus after the
referral of a number of species to segregate Euchile, Microepidendrum,
Oestlundia, and Prosthechea. However, a phylogenetic analysis of DNA
sequence data indicates that Epidendrum kienastii, currently included in
Encyclia, belongs in a separate, strongly supported clade as the sister
of Alamania, from which it differs markedly in vegetative and floral
morphology. Here we refer Epidendrum kienastii to a new, monotypic
genus, Amoana. It is easily distinguished from other genera of Laeliinae
by the following set of characters: pseudobulbs narrowly-cylindric,
leaves lanceolate, callus with two conspicuous, divergent, digitiform
processes on the base of the mid lobe of the labellum, and column
reflexed in the middle. It is endemic to mid-elevations of south-central
Mexico.
